definition: (literary pronunciation, still advocated in Taiwan) to rule/to sentence/to allow
to listen/to hear/to obey/a can (loanword from English "tin")/classifier for canned beverages

sentences.english: We stood there listening to our own breathing.
sentences.chinese: 我們站在那裏聆聽着我們自己的呼吸聲。

sentences.english: Listen to yourself and do what excites you.
sentences.chinese: 聆聽你內心的想法，做自己想做的事。

sentences.english: Play that song You and I listened to .
sentences.chinese: 播放那首我們曾聆聽過的歌吧。

sentences.english: Listen and you shall hear God speak.
sentences.chinese: 聆聽，你就會聽到上帝說話。

sentences.english: The music is all around us, all you have to do, is listening.
sentences.chinese: 只要傾耳聆聽，音樂便無處不在。

sentences.english: And, as sheep, we need to listen for his voice.
sentences.chinese: 那麼，作爲小羊，我們應該聆聽他的聲音。

sentences.english: The eloquence of the President moved all hearts who listened to him.
sentences.chinese: 總統的辯才感動了所有聆聽者的心。

sentences.english: After we have listened, we have to talk with God in prayer.
sentences.chinese: 我們聆聽了神的話後，必須在禱告中與神對談。

sentences.english: Tonight, I am listening to a deeper way.
sentences.chinese: 今夜，我聆聽來自更深處的聲音。

sentences.english: I rap for listeners, blunt heads, fly ladies and prisoners.
sentences.chinese: 我爲聆聽者，大麻葉而說唱，也能讓女士，囚徒。

sentences.english: Show you’re listening by your nonverbal communication.
sentences.chinese: 用你的肢體語言表明你正在聆聽。

sentences.english: A good listener must be good at asking questions.
sentences.chinese: 一個好的聆聽者應該善於問問題。

sentences.english: Listen to the world around you.
sentences.chinese: 細細聆聽你耳旁的這個世界。

definition: immediately/at once/at that moment/at the moment
to pass through/to penetrate/by means of/via
to know from experience/to learn through experience/to realize/understanding/experience
to join/to connect/to link up/to communicate
to yield/to permit/to let sb do sth/to have sb do sth/to make sb (feel sad etc)/by (indicates the agent in a passive clause, like 被[bei4])
